data.title: Allow to run 'code -w' and return when vscode is running already
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: macOs 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ensure that vscode is not running
2. In a shell, run `code -w file`
3. vscode is launched and `file` is opened
4. Close the window
5. `code -w file` does not return
6. Quit vscode
7. `code -w file` returns

Expected result:

`code -w file` should have returned at step 5 after the window is closed

data.title: Breakpoint shown in wrong location
data.body:
Testing #24403

* have the setup described in the React guide (i.e. debug config + npm start)
* launch the Chrome debugger
* put a breakpoint in a click handler
* type
* observe the application relaunches, the Chrome debugger reconnects, but there is now an extra breakpoint painted:

![bp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/24899298/0e79db40-1ea0-11e7-9c6f-edcd73b67cca.gif)

data.title: Multiple builds on the same commit might come up with different results
data.body:
We can't allow this to happen since the Azure CDN takes time to re-cache everything and then we'll get hash mismatches.

cc @alexandrudima

data.title: Remove "JOAO" from Readme title
data.body: It appears @joaomoreno 's local readme made it into the master branch. This pull request simply removes it from the readme again.

data.title: Chrome debugger: Would be nice to see location of console messages
data.body:
Testing #24403

It would be nice if we could show the file + line number when we print a console message in the debug console. I have found this to be a nice way to jump between relevant locations while debugging.

Expected:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/24898015/7f4ba704-1e9b-11e7-99a1-fbbfdd76a5fb.png)


Actual:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/24898003/70fa748c-1e9b-11e7-83bd-6a23644db84d.png)

data.title: Merge link detection code between terminal, debug console and exception widget

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Follow up on #24451.

This would also mean that debug console and exception widget will start recognising http links and paths without column (terminal regex would need general tweaking for the column case).

data.title: C_Cpp autocomplete doesn't recognize C++ lambda function
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

Code:

#include <string>
#include <vector>
using namespace std;
struct film {std::string title; int year;};

int main() {
  void *actorFile = NULL; // I modified it to NULL for simplicity.
  string player("Player");
  int numActors = 0; // // I modified it to 0 for simplicity.
  
  int *firstIter = (int *)actorFile + 1 + 0;
  int *lastIter = (int *)actorFile + 1 + numActors;
  int *iter = lower_bound(firstIter, lastIter, player, [&](int actorInfoOffset, const string &targetName){
    string actorName((char *)actorFile + actorInfoOffset);
    return actorName < targetName;
  });
  return 0;
}

Problem: "[" inside the function body is underlined, saying "expected expression".

data.title: Warning messages could hint towards disabled/missing extension
data.body:
Testing #24403

https://github.com/facebookincubator/create-react-app/blob/master/packages/react-scripts/template/README.md#debugging-in-the-editor

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/24897719/47d054ce-1e9a-11e7-9a88-233d63928e81.png)

I initially thought the guide is obsolete.

I have the Chrome debugger extension, but it is disabled (same as not having it installed). So perhaps we could improve the warning messages when a `"type"` is missing to hint that an extension is missing.

data.title: Formatting breaks after certain nesting level for tab indentation
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 64-bit

Steps to reproduce:

1. Convert to/use tab indentation
2. Save with `"editor.formatOnSave": true` or perform auto-format (`Alt-Shift-F`)

Tab indentation example (indentation is forcibly replaced with spaces when Step 2 is performed): 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1776970/24896767/088d95aa-1eb4-11e7-9a9f-d0fad2ec8a68.png)

Space indentation example (missing indentation guides reappear when zoom level is brought back up):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1776970/24896813/341f4e8e-1eb4-11e7-8070-b9c5e31f00ef.png)

It appears as though indentation levels reset (in a way) after 4 nesting levels, but only for tab indentation.

I have tried without success:
- Changing the line endings
- Disabling any extensions not installed by default

data.title: Text become fuzzy and unusable after scroll
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0 Insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1703

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install it on a Hi-DPI screen device with 125% scale (May not require, it's my environment)
2. Paste some long code into editor
3. Take a screenshot without image compress
4. Scroll down mouse wheel by once, take another screenshot, or feel it with your eye

## Screenshot
![normal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4962408/24896107/fc9697b2-1ec5-11e7-9dda-387ab1b50745.png)
> This is normal (clearly)

![fuzzy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4962408/24896116/08febf48-1ec6-11e7-87e0-13387a384386.png)
> This is **fuzzy**

## Screenshot with zoom
----
![detail_clear](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4962408/24896124/12782000-1ec6-11e7-9483-381673777ddf.png)
> This is normal

![detail_fuzzy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4962408/24896140/26bf061e-1ec6-11e7-9675-0c4d1d0c2095.png)
> This is **fuzzy**

## Possible reason
I think it's an **upstream issue** with Chromium, if Code use **CSS transform** to scroll/move element will cause this issue.
I hope develop team can take a look with this, this make Code **unusable at all**

## See also
- Symbol & Text may fuzz and unclear (#7799) [upstream, electron]

data.title: Goto definition should jump to start of definition if used while inside of definition instead of saying "no definition found"
data.body:
I provide vscode a large definition range so the control-click tooltip shows the entire definition. The problem is, trying to navigate to the definition within the definition shows the 'no definition found' error. Instead, the cursor should jump to the start of the definition as normal.

Using peek definition (`Alt-F12`)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/356714/24894564/0bcc5cac-1e40-11e7-8c07-4b65375e0e57.png)

Using goto definition (`F12`)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/356714/24894583/2932ea2c-1e40-11e7-8936-545e94b6ef2d.png)


- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

data.title: Not supporting `async/await` during extension development due to NodeJs is not latest.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

Cannot use `async/await` during extension development. VScode is using node v6.5.0 rather than the latest node v7 which supports `async/await`. Is it possible to manually switch node version to v7?

data.title: Update coffeescript.tmLanguage.json, fixing highlighting for embedded js
data.body:
In coffee-script, `` means not normal strings but embedded js, but it's not correctly highlighted in vscode, like this: 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13058150/24889910/6d1f719c-1e9f-11e7-9a2f-d3e642de1317.png)

After this fix, it should be like this: 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13058150/24889940/90c7f04c-1e9f-11e7-84dd-7ec903c1f91b.png)

~~Note that in embedded js the symbols like `()[]{}` is green rather than white. This is intentional in order to indicate this is embedded js, not coffee-script.~~

[EDIT] Now in embedded js the symbols like `()[]{}` is white, not green. I found in string mode some feathers like brackets pairing is not avaiable, so it's better to change to normal code mode instead of string mode.

data.title: Porting a couple of community complex command fixes
data.body: Changes were made to generated complex command content. Porting changes back to vscode source code.

data.title: VS Code not Reading Environment Variables from VirtualEnv when launching from terminal
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:
I normally us virtualenv when working on python projects. For matplotlib I have to keep a script that modifies my python path in a folder and I set that script as my pythonPath in the launch config. I then initialize the virtualenv in terminal and use `code .` to launch vs code from the directory I need to work in. This forces vs code to load everything in the virtalenv as part of the VS codes environment. 

Since updated to 1.11.1, this no longer works. It doesn't recognize whats in my virtualenv folders. I downgraded back to 1.10 and it started to work again immediately.

data.title: improvement/feature request -set language mode using ⌘/Ctrl + shift +p
data.body:
It really would be nice to set language mode for files only using <kbd>⌘/Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> +<kbd>P</kbd>. At the moment changing/setting the language on created/new files is only possible using the mouse.

I remember to use this feature a lot on Sublime Text, and would be great to have it in this editor.

I think that is one of the few options that can't be accessed via keyboard.

data.title: Dvorak-Qwerty Cmd binding is broken on Sierra
data.body:
Dvorak-Qwerty Cmd keyboard layout maps Cmd/Alt/Ctrl keys to QWERTY layout so that shortcuts like Cmd-C/V/X/Z are laid out ergonomically. The latest VS Code breaks the cmd/ctrl/alt mapping - mapping these keys to their Dvorak layout rather than the QWERTY layout



- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z)

|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|vscode-dash|deerawan|1.4.0|

|hive-sql|josephtbradley|0.0.2|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.59|
|swagger-doc-viewer|mimarec|1.0.4|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.3|

|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.3.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup input source as Dvorak-QWERTY Cmd layout  in preferences
2. Cmd shortcuts are mapped to Dvorak layout and not QWERTY layout. (try Cmd+C (QWERTY location))

data.title: Improper highlighting for jsdoc record types
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write a function that accepts an object. Annotate the object parameter like this:
```js
/**
 * My awesome function.
 * @param {{id: string, name: string}} object An object with an id and name field.
 */
function myAwesomeFunction(object) {
  const { name, id } = object.
  // do stuff with name and id
}
```
2. Observe that it doesn't get syntax highlighting like other jsdoc types.

Normally the type of a function parameter gets a brighter color. However, record types like the one above don't get this highlighting. I'm not sure if this is standard jsdoc, but it is supported by the [Google Closure Compiler](https://github.com/google/closure-compiler/wiki/Annotating-JavaScript-for-the-Closure-Compiler#record-type).

data.title: Allow Code Lenses to only Provide a Title and no Backing Command
data.body:
Fixes #24209

**Bug**
Currently, for the js/ts references code lens, even if there are zero references you can click on the lens. This display an empty peek view. The root cause is that we always have to provide a command for these lenses, even if no action can really be taken

**Fix**
Allow code lenses to only register a title for the lens with no actual backing command. This lets a code lens display info to the user while not potentially incorrectly suggesting that more information is available by clicking

![apr-10-2017 15-03-27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/24884575/e2241b92-1dfe-11e7-80e4-1c6280aa8c5f.gif)

data.title: Search match-word inconsistent behavior
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan 10.11.16

**Bug was not present in VSCode Version 1.10.2**

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any project and expand the "Search" sidebar
2. Enable match-word.
3. Disable match-regex. ( "Use Exclude Settings" and match-case appear to work independently and have no effect on the bug as described )
4. Identify a commonly used function which has no parameters ( ie. void SomeClass::foobar() )
5. Search for the function name ( ie. "foobar" ). Note that it appears to work as intended.
6. Modify the search to "foobar(". Note that the search results are significantly reduced, and excludes some valid finds the previous search found.
7. Modify the search to "foobar()". Note that the search finds practically nothing unless a file containing a match is currently open.
8. Disable match-case. Note all of the search results which should have been a match now show up.

data.title: Fix webview sizing when zooming
data.body:
Fixes #5745

**Bug**
When zooming in or out, webview contents are not properly sized to fill their parent element

**Fix**
Add a layout method on the webview that manually sets the content size
